headline: This Company Just Announced Long-Term Contracts For Nuclear Power Amid Rosy Outlook For This Commodity
summary: Shares of Energy Fuels moved higher before Monday's stock market after the uranium producer announced it exceeded its previously disclosed guidance for 2025 uranium production and sales.  The company also said it signed two new long-term uranium sales contracts with U.S. nuclear power generating companies.  Energy Fuels reported early Monday that it expects to sell a total of 360,000 pounds of uranium concentrate, or yellowcake, in Q4, which represents an increase of 50% vs. a year ago.
